The chronicle calls Oleg the Prophet.
narration.Після смерті Рюрика він став опікуном ма: After Rurik’s death, he became guardian of young Ihor and ruled in his name in Novgorod.
narration.Він був воєводою, родичем Рюрика й опіку: He was a military commander, a relative of Rurik, and the prince’s guardian.
narration.Бережу престол за Ігорем. Русь треба з'є: I keep the throne for Ihor. Rus’ must be united, not divided.
narration.Вчителю Олеже, а коли я стану князем?: Teacher Oleg, when will I become prince?
narration.Навчишся справам княжим — тоді й сядиш н: Learn princely affairs—then you will sit on your father’s throne.
narration.Близько 882 року Олег рушив Дніпром «із: Around the year 882, Oleg sailed down the Dnipro “from the Varangians to the Greeks,” seeking a capital for all Rus’.
narration.З дружиною та малим Ігорем пристав до ки: With his retinue and young Ihor, he moored by the Kyiv hills.
narration.Княже, місто на важливому торговому шлях: Prince, the city lies on an important trade route. It’s time to go ashore.
narration.Спершу — розвідка. У Києві правлять Аско: First—reconnaissance. Askold and Dir rule in Kyiv.
We’ll appear as merchants. The rest—according to the situation.
narration.Олег удався до хитрощів — прикинувся куп: Oleg resorted to a ruse—he pretended to be a merchant and invited Askold and Dir “on behalf of the guests.”
narration.Купці? Чого хочете від київського двору?: Merchants? What do you want from the Kyivan court?
narration.Ви не з княжого роду. Ось князь — син Рю: You are not of princely lineage. Here is the prince—the son of the Ruriks.
narration.Після цієї ради Аскольда і Діра було усу: After this council, Askold and Dir were removed from power.
narration.Олег увійшов до Києва, посадив там Ігоря: Oleg entered Kyiv, seated Ihor there, and ruled as guardian.
narration.Хай буде Київ матір'ю міст руських!: Let Kyiv be the mother of the cities of Rus’!
The north and south of Rus’ are united.
narration.Відтоді Київ став головним містом держав: From then on, Kyiv became the state’s main city, and Oleg—the unifying prince.
narration.Він заклав основи могутньої Київської Ру: He laid the foundations of a mighty Kyivan Rus’ that would last for centuries.
narration.Київ стоїть на високих пагорбах. Над міс: Kyiv stands on high hills. Above the city are wooden idols of Perun, Dazhboh, and Mokosh.
narration.Процесії йдуть до святилищ, несуть жертв: Processions go to the sanctuaries, bring offerings, swear oaths, and sing hymns to the ancient gods.
narration.Так було завжди… Дим жертовників змішуєт: It has always been so… The smoke of the altars blends with the Dnipro’s mist.
narration.Та невидимо наближається зміна звичного: Yet, unseen, a change to the familiar order of days draws near.
narration.У княжому теремі Володимир слухає послів: In the princely palace, Volodymyr listens to envoys from various lands.
narration.Княже, Закон Мойсея навчає справедливост: Prince, the Law of Moses teaches justice and the commandments.
narration.Віра ісламу — сила єдності та покори Єди: The faith of Islam is the strength of unity and submission to the One.
narration.Христова віра — милосердя, світло й спас: The faith of Christ is mercy, light, and salvation.
narration.Я зважую: що принесе Русі мир і лад, що: I weigh this: what will bring Rus’ peace and order, uplift people’s spirits, and teach them to live differently?
We are pleased with the Greek faith.
narration.По місту покотилася чутка: ідолів знесут: A rumor rolled through the city: the idols would be taken down.
narration.Хтось кидає у воду квіти, хтось мовчить,: Some throw flowers into the water; others are silent, clenching their fists.
narration.Довго плив ідол проти течії — ніби давня: Long did the idol drift against the current—as if ancient Rus’ were resisting.
narration.А тоді вода забрала його, і на березі ст: Then the water took it away, and the shore grew quiet, like before sunrise.
narration.На ранок лунав дзвін. Люди виходили до Д: In the morning, bells rang. Families went to the Dnipro together.
In the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit.
narration.Ступайте у хвилі. Хай омиє вас не лише в: Step into the waves. Let not only water wash you, but also hope.
I take off my weapons—and enter the water.
narration.Сонце торкається поверхні. Обличчя сяють: The sun touches the surface. Faces shine with purity.
narration.У місто прийшли нові клопоти — і нове жи: New troubles—and new life—came to the city.
narration.При світлі свічок переписуємо книги в мо: By candlelight we copy books in monastic cells.
narration.При церквах відкриваємо школи — діти вив: We open schools at the churches—children trace their first letters.
narration.На пергаменті з’являються рівні рядки но: Even lines in a new script—Cyrillic—appear on parchment. Education instills not only knowledge but also a different language of the heart.
narration.Київ, омитий Дніпром і словом, входить у: Kyiv, washed by the Dnipro and the Word, enters a new era.
narration.Бажаєте спробувати допомогти записати ва: Would you like to try helping record the important events?
narration.Так Київ, омитий Дніпром і словом, увійш: Thus Kyiv, washed by the Dnipro and the Word, entered a new era.
narration.Зимою до Любеча тягнулися засніжені шлях: In winter, snow-covered roads stretched toward Liubech. Princely retinues came on foot and by sleigh from different lands—Kyiv, Chernihiv, and Smolensk.
narration.Кожен віз свій стяг і герб, їхали у влас: Each bore his own banner and coat of arms, traveling in his own attire, surrounded by warriors. The frost hushed voices but not anxiety: the road here is harder than ice—for it leads through old wrongs.
narration.Стійте рівно під знаменами. Князі незаба: Stand straight beneath the banners. The princes will enter the town soon.
narration.Гості Любеча, тримайте мир у серці — на: Guests of Liubech, keep peace in your hearts—you have gathered for counsel!
narration.У центрі містечка стояв дерев’яний дім і: In the center of the town stood a wooden hall with a great hearth. There the princes assembled and began negotiations: they argued over borders, over wrongs, over old campaigns.
narration.Слова летіли, наче іскри, та під попелом: Words flew like sparks, yet beneath the ashes one felt the weariness of endless feuds.
narration.Межі треба підтвердити, щоб торг і шлях: Borders must be confirmed so that trade and routes do not suffer.
narration.Кривду минулу згадаємо — та миром покриє: We will recall past wrongs—but cover them with peace.
narration.Хай кожен держить отчину свою — і не про: Let each hold his own patrimony—and not stretch out his hand beyond measure.
narration.У паузах лунала головна формула дня: «Ко: In the pauses the day’s main formula sounded: “Let each hold his own patrimony,” and it steered the talk back to common purpose.
narration.Нарешті принесли хрест. Князі один по од: At last they brought the cross. One by one the princes laid their hands upon it and pronounced an oath of peace.
narration.На хресті — слово тверде. Хто нарушить —: Upon the cross is a steadfast word. Whoever breaks it—let him fear the judgment of God and of men.
narration.Промінь зимового сонця пробився крізь ві: A ray of winter sun pierced the window and lay upon the wood—a simple sign, taken as a blessing.
narration.У цю мить кожен побачив у сусіді не лише: In that moment each saw in his neighbor not only a rival, but a partner in a great cause—the preservation of Rus’.
narration.Розгорнули карту. На ній позначили землі: They unfolded a map. Lands were marked upon it, and each set his sign: whose principality lay where, and where the borders ran.
narration.Київ — за київським князем. Чернігів — з: Kyiv is for the Kyivan prince. Chernihiv for the Chernihiv prince. Smolensk for the Smolensk prince.
narration.Кличу до столу. Хліб і сіль поміж князів: I call you to the table. Bread and salt pass among the princes—as a pledge of peace.
narration.Того дня єдність повернулася не гучним с: That day unity returned not with loud words, but with simple gestures.
narration.Увечері над Дніпром спалахнули зорі. Вар: In the evening, stars flared above the Dnipro. Guards on the outskirts stood by their fires, listening as the town grew quiet.
narration.Згода тривала недовго, та пам’ять про ми: The accord did not last long, but the memory of peace and the word upon the cross would become a guide.
narration.Коли руки Русі розходяться, рятує її не: When the hands of Rus’ drift apart, it is not the sword that saves her, but an agreement.
narration.Порада в Любечі стала пам’яттю Русі про: The council at Liubech became Rus’ memory of peace as a guarantee of strength.

ui.auto_forward_time_description: Choose the time in seconds before the dialogue auto-forwards. If "{{textSpeedName}}" is enabled, the auto-forward will be executed after the typewriter effect is completed. (You can edit this value if "{{autoName}}" is enabled)
ui.primary_color_description: Choose the primary color for the theme.
ui.solid_color_description: Choose the solid color for the theme. It can be black or white and will be contrasting with the primary color. So if the primary color is dark, the solid color will be white, and a the other way around.
ui.text_speed_description: Choose the speed of the typewriter effect. If is set to 0 ( off ) the text will appear instantly.
ui.theme_mode_description: Choose between light, dark, or system theme mode.

ui.you_sure_to_load_save: Are you sure you want to load this save file?
ui.you_sure_to_return_main_menu: Are you sure you want to return to the main menu? All unsaved progress will be lost.
